thread.title: A Plymouth woman has had hair extensions after recovering from cancer.
thread.title_full: A Plymouth woman has had hair extensions after recovering from cancer.

title: A Plymouth woman has had hair extensions after recovering from cancer.
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device A Plymouth woman has had hair extensions after recovering from cancer. 19 March 2017 Last updated at 00:21 GMT A mother-of-two whose fight with cancer left her with bald patches is delighted with her new hair extensions. 
Kat Parker, 29, has been clear of cancer for two years - but said her lack of hair left her feeling "unfeminine". 
GG's salon in Plymouth helped her to raise more than Â£900 to have special hair extensions for people suffering severe hair loss. 
Her husband Martin Roberts said she "looks amazing" as she revealed her new hair three years after her breast cancer diagnosis. 
Watch Inside Out South West's story on BBC One on Monday 20 March at 19:30 BST and on the iPlayer for 30 days thereafter.
